name: Wenxi Wang
content: Wenxi Wang - University of Virginia Wenxi Wang Assistant Professor The University of Virginia Department of Computer Science Email: wenxiw@virginia.edu CV Twitter We are hiring Fall'26 PhDs !! About My interests lie in the intersection of Software Engineering, Software Security, Formal Methods, and Machine Learning. My research focuses on advancing Neuro-Symbolic AI to improve the scalability and efficiency of automated reasoning systems, while enabling AI models to develop reasoning and verification capabilities. Beyond foundational research, I design specialized Neuro-Symbolic methods to enhance software reliability, including modern AI systems, and explore verifiable code generation to make software development more trustworthy and error-resistant. I currently lead the Hiprel Group, where I fortunately work with a number of talented and motivated students. I did my PhD at The University of Texas at Austin, supervised by Sarfraz Khurshid. During my PhD, I have also been closely working with Kenneth McMillan and Darko Marinov. I am looking for self-motivated PhD (Fall 2026) and internship students (all year round) who share similar research interests with me and is interested in joining our Hiprel Group! Please click here for more information. If you're interested in working with me, please fill out this form. You’re also welcome to follow up via email. While I will review all submissions, I apologize in advance if I'm unable to respond to everyone. ​ News [Sep 2025] Excited to share that our RFCScope paper, the first paper authored by my intern (Mrigank Pawagi) and PhD student (Lize Shao) under my supervision, has been accepted at ASE 2025! [Dec 2024] Invited to serve as a PC member for ICSE 2026. [Nov 2024] Invited to serve as a PC member for CAV 2025. [Oct 2024] Invited to serve as a PC member for LLM4Code 2025 Workshop. [Aug 2024] Invited to serve as a PC member for OOPSLA 2025. [Apr 2024] Invited to serve as a reviewer for TOSEM. [Jan 2024] Our NeuroBack paper got accepted by ICLR 2024! [Dec 2023] I am honorably invited to serve as a Program Committee Member for ASE 2024! [Dec 2023] I am invited by the program chair committee of ICML 2024 to serve as a Reviewer. [Oct 2023] we have released our DataBack, the first publicly available large-scale dataset (containing 120,286 data samples) in deep learning for SAT! [Aug 2023] I am invited by the program chair committee of ICLR 2024 to serve as a Reviewer. [Jul 2023] Our IAM repair paper got accepted by ASE’2023! [Jul 2023] I am honorably invited as the session chair of “Verification and Testing” session in ECOOP 2023. [Jun 2023] Received the George J. Heuer, Jr. Ph.D. Endowed Graduate Fellowship Fund for 2023-2024 from the Cockrell School of Engineering, UT Austin. [May 2023] Our CadiBack tool paper got accepted by SAT’2023! [Aug 2022] Honorably got in Rising Stars in EECS 2022 [May-Aug 2022] Joined Automated Reasoning Group at Amazon Web Service as a research summer intern. Stuckey A Bit-Vector Solver with Word-Level Propagation Integration of AI and OR Techniques in Constraint Programming (CPAIOR 2016) PDF ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Services ICSE 2026 PC Member CAV 2025 PC Member Session Chair of “LLM for SE 2” and "SE for AI 2" sessions in ASE 2024 LLM4Code 2025 Workshop PC Member OOPSLA 2025 PC Member TOSEM Reviewer ASE 2024 Program Committee Member ICML 2024 Reviewer ICLR 2024 Reviewer Session Chair of “Verification and Testing” session in ECOOP 2023 NeurIPS 2023 Reviewer ICML 2023 Reviewer PLDI 2023 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member ECOOP 2023 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member and Extended Review Committee Member ISSTA 2023 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member USENIX Security 2023 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member NeurIPS 2022 Reviewer ISSTA 2022 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member PLDI 2022 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member PLDI 2021 Artifact Evaluation Committee Member External Reviewer: TACAS 2022, FSE 2021, ICST 2020, ASE 2020, ISSRE 2020, and ICSE 2019 ​ Teaching [Fall 2024] CS6501 Machine Learning for Software Reliability, Graduate Level, UVA [Fall 2025] CS6501 Machine Learning for Software Reliability, Graduate Level, UVA Wenxi Wang Assistant Professor The University of Virginia CS Department Email: wenxiw@virginia.edu CV Twitter We are hiring Fall'26 PhDs! ! ​ About My interests lie in the intersection of Software Engineering, Software Security, Formal Methods, and Machine Learning. I am particularly interested in advancing NeuroSymbolic approaches to enhance the reliability and trustworthiness of software and AI systems. I did my PhD at The University of Texas at Austin, supervised by Sarfraz Khurshid. During my PhD, I have also been closely working with Kenneth McMillan and Darko Marinov. I am looking for self-motivated PhD (Fall 2026) and internship students (all year round) who share similar research interests with me and is interested in joining our Hiprel Group!
